posts.classes: post-10690 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-exun-2021-22
posts.title: Exun 2021-22
posts.content:
A moment we’ve all been waiting for, Exun is back — bigger, better, international for a second time, and the most open and accessible it has ever been.

We bring to you Exun 2021-22: celebrating 26 years of India’s biggest high school tech symposium! With over 25 events, ranging from disciplines like web development, machine learning and programming to our novel SpaceTech, Girls’ in Tech, and Locus events, with a really broad range of mini-tasks and competitions, you’re sure to find something for you!

Exun Talks is back this year, with professionals speaking on a variety of STEM topics, and our flagship international cryptic hunt, Sudocrypt, is open to all regardless of country and age. We also have a host of prizes to be won! We assure that at the end of your journey at Exun 2021-22 that is held 14st-22nd January 2022, you’ll leave taking something invaluable to you, from skills to experiences to lifelong friends.

For registration, Exun 2021-22 invite and schedule, and all other details, visit https://reg.exun.co/invite.
posts.author: Pratishtha Batra
posts.fullHtml:
Exun 2021-22

December 25, 2021Exun 2021-22Pratishtha Batra

A moment we’ve all been waiting for, Exun is back — bigger, better, international for a second time, and the most open and accessible it has ever been.

We bring to you Exun 2021-22: celebrating 26 years of India’s biggest high school tech symposium! With over 25 events, ranging from disciplines like web development, machine learning and programming to our novel SpaceTech, Girls’ in Tech, and Locus events, with a really broad range of mini-tasks and competitions, you’re sure to find something for you!

Exun Talks is back this year, with professionals speaking on a variety of STEM topics, and our flagship international cryptic hunt, Sudocrypt, is open to all regardless of country and age. We also have a host of prizes to be won! We assure that at the end of your journey at Exun 2021-22 that is held 14st-22nd January 2022, you’ll leave taking something invaluable to you, from skills to experiences to lifelong friends.

For registration, Exun 2021-22 invite and schedule, and all other details, visit https://reg.exun.co/invite.

Leave a comment

posts.title: Geek-A-Hertz 2021
posts.content:
Geek-A-Hertz 2021 was held between 8-17 November 2021 by St. Mark’s Sr. Sec. Public School , Meera Bagh. Exun Clan bagged the Overall Runners Up trophy!
The individual results are as follows:

B-Plan — Idea Pitching — Winners
Saksham Raheja
Shireen Rajora
Sneha Chandra
Sneha Pandey

B-Plan — Idea Pitching — Second Runners Up
Mehul Srivastava
Mannat Kaur
Eshan Sharma
Aanya Yaduvanshi

WebCoders — Web Designing — Second Runners Up
Samik Tuteja
Darsh Sikka

Binary Masters — Programming — Winners
Vishesh Saraswat
Vedant Singh

Surprise — Winners
Bhuvnesh Nagpal

Gamers’ Paradise — Game Designing — Winners
Adi Mathur
Aadibhav Prasad
Ananya Mangla
Shaurya Malhotra

Gamers’ Paradise — Game Designing — Second Runners Up
Manan Jindal
Garv Jain
Nirvan Dongre
Sneha Chandra

Lights Camera Action — Filmmaking — Winners
Ishita Bhargava
Sana Chawla
Myra Vaish
Aditya Banka

Congratulations to all the winners!

posts.classes: post-10684 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized
posts.title: Blender 3.0 Release Commemoration Video
posts.content:
Exun Clan has been using Blender 3D for over a decade, from when it was in its early days to today, and we’ve made a short video appreciating the software as it reaches its landmark 3.0 release: https://youtu.be/4YYhhQsO_J8

Made by Exun Clan with in-house assets and creations made using Blender3D, the free and open-source 3D creation tool, by Eshan and Ashvin. Work showcased was created by Rahul, Pulkit, Rudraneel, Aniket, Arunim, Josh, Ashvin, and others.
posts.author: Ashvin Verma
posts.fullHtml:
Blender 3.0 Release Commemoration Video

December 16, 2021UncategorizedAshvin Verma

Exun Clan has been using Blender 3D for over a decade, from when it was in its early days to today, and we’ve made a short video appreciating the software as it reaches its landmark 3.0 release: https://youtu.be/4YYhhQsO_J8

Made by Exun Clan with in-house assets and creations made using Blender3D, the free and open-source 3D creation tool, by Eshan and Ashvin. Work showcased was created by Rahul, Pulkit, Rudraneel, Aniket, Arunim, Josh, Ashvin, and others.

Leave a comment
